intro: Heterotropa lutchuensis, commonly known as the Lutchuensis heterotropa, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
